Reviews.Title: “Modern and centrally-located”
Reviews.Author: Gita02
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here overnight but we found the staff to be very helpful and courteous. The concierge helped us book dinner at a nice restaurant in artsy Trastevere and helped us get a taxi to the airport early the next morning. The rooms are clean and modern-looking considering this used to be the Rome residence of Queen Margherita of Savoy. They have a whole array of bathroom amenities featuring unique scents for their bath gel, shampoo, lotion and conditioner -- something my young daughter took notice of. Really no complaints about the place. We didn't have breakfast here so I couldn't comment on it

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but when is the restaurant open?”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller550
Reviews.Content: So long as I am in Rome, I could sleep in the gutter and eat 3 day old bread and be happy. This was my fourth trip in 15 years, and I enjoyed this hotel. The in room decor is a shock to say the least. If the front desk staff dressed to match, they'd be wearing gogo boots, a white patent leather mini skirt, and a red turtle neck. Rooms were clean and in order. Staff was friendly. The bar was nice, but vacant, with no patrons or bartender to be found. Restaurant was the same. Internet was free, but quite slow in the evening. Elevators were quite small by European standards. If three or more people share a lift, you'll be really well acquainted when you reach your floor. Quiet with no noisy neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Area with only one Complaint”
Reviews.Author: CathynDan_GA
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in great area of Rome. Reception staff and concierge extremely attentive and helpful. Nice and very clean rooms, although somewhat modern decor for our taste. Lovely balcony overlooking the city. Only complaint was an issue we had with trying to get breakfast one morning. They said we were "not on their list" so wouldn't seat us. Put us at a table outside the restaurant. We only wanted coffe and pastries. Once we complained to the front desk, they apologized profusely and brought us fruit, cheese plates and extras saying our breakfast would be at no charge. When we checked out later, however, they had charges us 60 Euro for our meal. We explained but they would only reduce the cost to 30 Euros. Disappointing way to end an otherwise very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff and service”
Reviews.Author: mellismi
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the US on a Saturday morning at around 12:30. We were told that no rooms were available so we should go take a walk. After returning from our walk, after 2pm, our room still was not ready, as we sat in the lobby waiting the staff ignored us until we got up and asked again. The service is awful, the staff neglects the guests, acts as if they are a bother and they aren't willing to help. My wife was looking for some information regarding various activities, etc. the women told her that she had no info... On top of this, the Internet connectivity is absolutely horrible, so slow that I have trouble sending emails. The cleaning staff roams the hallways early morning slamming doors so loud that I am woken up from a deep sleep... Believe it or not, the hotel also cannot send post cards for you, we were told that we needed to go to the newsstand and buy stamps ourselves or give them exact change in cash if we wanted to send any postcards. They are unable or unwilling to bill to the room... They also had no pool, no gym and no spa. Apparently they are renovating and had no idea when the renovation would be complete. In summary, this is far from a 5 star resort and Marriott should be embarased for calling it one or making it part of their "autograph collection". I would never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, restaurant lacking”
Reviews.Author: Scott G
Reviews.Content: Arrived early morning with jet lag from the US and the staff was great. We enjoyed our 2 night stay in a modern but comfortable room. The street noise was minimal even on a lower floor, the location worked well for seeing ancient Rome, and the neighborhood was good (safe, clean, etc.). We really enjoyed the hotel portion of our stay. The hotel's restaurant fell flat. We ordered 3 things: 1 dessert and 2 breakfasts. Only one of these items was available (a breakfast off the menu) and that didn't even show up as the picture suggested (w toast). It was a challenge getting the check... We had to give our order 3 times... And it was expansive relative to alternatives. But the bar is great is you want to sit by yourself in silence.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Well Located, Fantastic and Attentive Service”
Reviews.Author: Mason H
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and over time it becomes difficult to remember one hotel versus another. That will never be the issue here, as the service alone makes it memorable, while the attractive decor and stunning rooms made it wonderful to return to after a day of sightseeing. My family's first trip to Rome was enhanced by the recommendations of Giada, the concierge who handled so many of our reservations, and the ongoing attentiveness of the entire staff. I will return to the Boscolo Palace Roma and I recommend it without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Gave us cake and champagne for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Adam N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first 2 nights of our honeymoon using Marriott Rewards points. We loved it. They gave us champagne and a delicious cake to celebrate our marriage. And even though the room is oddly decorated with black diamond walls and modern furnishings, we had a balcony, AC and great shower. Breakfast was also great and staff was very attentive. We very much enjoyed our stay here. On the contrary, never ever stay at the Boscolo in Venice. It is horrible. But the Boscolo in Rome is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in great area.”
Reviews.Author: Geo H
Reviews.Content: Must admit we are staying here 6 nights with Marriott points. They are an affiliate. Buffet plus menu breakfast free in our pkg. $35. Euro breakfast is so filling we could skip lunch. Front desk, concierge and top-hatted Doorman super helpful. Booked me a tour bus day trip to Tivoli with pick up at hotel, no hassle. Rooms sparkling white marble tile. Finest facilities. We have a breathtaking view of the Pallazzios from our private terrace. one block from Metro station. Class area of town with many fine restaurant choices. Pool/spa under construction, looks almost finished, like a modern Roman bath. Have already booked nights for our son to stay on his honeymoon, it's is that good. U.S. Embassy across street and Italian government offices within a block, so probably the safest place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this city & hotel”
Reviews.Author: JL_SP_1965
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and friendly staff. So good to have spent some days in this beautiful location. Was my first time in Rome, I absolutely loved it. I loved the view from my room. I hope to be back in Europe and in Rome next year, I will surely come back to this hotel. It is in a very quiet area, the perfect position to explore Rome by walking. Thanx!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, but good location”
Reviews.Author: catbird41
Reviews.Content: We transferred to this hotel using our Marriott points during our stay in Rome. Very disappointing! The room was about the size of a walk-in closet. The actual bathroom had no heat, so it felt like an outhouse. Granted, the decor is nice, but the accommodations were terrible. The average price is 200+ Euro or 40,000 marriott points and this is the smallest room in the hotel based on using Marriot points. If you are on a business trip, there is no area for using the internet or printing documents. The free internet service disconnects everytime your computer or telephone times out. They don't provide any real service for touring the city, but they do give you a map to find things on your own. BTW, we overheard the attendants speaking in Italian how they have to abide by Marriott standards in a negative way. The one good thing is, it is across the street from the US Embassy. I do not recommend anyone to stay at this hotel unless it is a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and well worth the splurge...great experience!”
Reviews.Author: D678
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simply beautiful with excellent service. We have never been pampered so much by a Marriott. Great location and near the Spanish steps. You can also hop on and off the Metro from the Barberini Metro stop to get around Rome all day for just 4 Euros for an all day Metro ticket. My boyfriend is a platinum Marriott rewards member and they pampered us to the extreme with a beautiful welcome gift of wine and Italian cheeses. The hotel is beautiful to photograph because it is so gorgeous and opulent. Wonderful continental breakfast with local meats, cheeses, fresh breads, desserts, coffees of your choice. This is also close to Cafe Du Paris (great cafe for an inexpensive coffee and treat- if you are standing and not getting a table).

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Location & Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Happy-MCS
Reviews.Content: We took my husband's daughter to Rome to start her study abroad program in Jan 2012. (6 days total). The hotel itself was sleek and modern with the Italian flare. The front desk staff spoke english and were all friendly and informative. The spacious room was all marble and the bathroom was heavenly!! The views were great and the US embassy is right across the street. We walked everywhere, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Coloseum, Campo De Fiori, Pantheon, Vatican City, etc. There were LOTS of restaurants to choose from all in easy walking distance. The shops were also close and had GREAT sales while we were there! The taxis were on strike several of the days we were there, so when we had to take my husband's daughter to meet up with her study abroad program people, the hotel thankfully had a car that we were able to use instead of lugging her luggage through all the cobblestone streets. Great hotel, great staff and WONDERFUL TRIP!! Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days while in Rome and like Rome, the hotel is simply beautiful. The room design was gorgeous and the location was great - close to a number of tourist sites and lots of food options. Would definitely stay here again. One complaint, albeit a small one, was the lack of a wine opener in the room. Room service was happy to help with opening a bottle but it took 15 minutes before they arrived which I found to be a bit inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but pricey and poor service”
Reviews.Author: H2o594
Reviews.Content: Expensive and nice but the service sucks they are not friendly and they make you feel like your not that welcome I stayed 2 nights and the secound daythey stopped opening the door for us when we left or entered the hotel. I just didnt like the service. But the rooms are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel, at an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Holta_O
Reviews.Content: The staying at the Boscolo Palace was very pleasant. The rooms were big enough and the staff was really helpful. The breakfast buffet was rich and they make really good cappuccinos. From the hotel you can reach most of the main attractions walking, or just take the metro Barberini witch is only 200 m away. The price was a little bit expensive, but it was Christmas time.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Lidiette R
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Italy for our honeymoon and Rome was our first stop. The room we booked was on the seventh floor and overlooked the city. The view was simply impressive. We slept with the windows open a few nights and i felt like i was in a dream when i got up at night and saw the city through the open shutter windows. Even the sheer white curtains that danced with the wind added to the magic. :) The staff was very helpful and polite. My husband never adjusted to the time difference so he often called the concierge throughout the night and he was never rude! He jokes and says he was his favorite person in italy. My favorite person was one of the waiters that worked in the restaurant during breakfast. He wore a smile the entire time and was extra attentive. I'm not sure if he was French, his english sounded somewhat different... anyway, not that their other staff was bad, but they could definitely benefit from hiring more staff like these two guys as they added to our experience!! The location was good. It's right in front of the US embassy and next to the Hard Rock Cafe and many other restaurants. Side note- although the restaurants along the street are unique and pretty, we didn't necessarily have any amazing food in any of them. Upon returning i was told we should have gone to other not so touristy spots. Next time we'll take a travel guide. . Lastly, we chose to walk everywhere and most places are a pretty good hike away. However, many tour buses pick up at the hotel every day so you don't have to walk the distance if you choose not too. We super enjoyed our stay and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Boscolo Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MoveableFeastAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for (sadly) only one night at the Boscolo Roma after a cruise. It's a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location - we loved every minute. The rooms are contemporary and sleek - it's in a posh neighboorhood, easy walk to metro and very near Trevi Fountain. The staff is so accomodating - the included breakfast and internet - was just icing on an already terrific cake. The rooms are good sized (not huge) the ammenities are perfect. Very cool shower! If you stay here, you will not be disappointed! Chic and Contemporary Inside - Classical Outside. We will be back for a longer stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DIVE60
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel on Via Veneto, directly across the street from the American Embassy. The hotel staff were excellent were very quick for any request. The restaurant and bar were a little pricey but the service and quality of food was excellent. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom shower was wonderful. Would definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Annabella44
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, staff, location, bar. Excellent--highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not sure justifies the price”
Reviews.Author: Yaron_Naveh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a brilliant location for visiting the important Rome attractions. The street is full with restaurants and is very safe as it is near the american embassy. Rooms look great after renovation, though they are relatively smaller than I expected and contain no bathtub. The staff was ok but they could be nicer. This hotel is on the pricy side. When I visited (May 2011) they still did not had spa and I'm not sure the price is justified for the value.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: PMSEACOAST
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated hotel is beautiful and is in the best location in the city. Service was first class and very professional. We were upgraded to a suite with stunning decor. Across from the American Embassy, a short walk to the subway, and the usual tourist sights. Beautiful bar area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Big Mama Mia!”
Reviews.Author: BOSTONTRAVELLER55
Reviews.Content: Hotel has been nicely renovated. Located on Via Venito not far from Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps. Several restaurants and curbside cafes on the street including those in the Boscolo. We enjoued our 3 day stay. Staff was great, food was great, concierge very helpful in making suggestions and pointing us in the right directions. We loved sitting in the Boscolo curbside cafe watching the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ginger7789
Reviews.Content: On 9/23/11 my husband & I stayed here on Marriott points. I believe this is a part of their "Autograph Collection" of hotels, more of a boutique hotel. So glad that we had the opportunity to stay here, only wish it had been for more than one night. When we arrived in the morning (after a long flight from the U.S.) we weren't expecting our room to be ready (and it wasn't). They did take our bags and we decided to have lunch there. It was very good - cheeses, meats, and wine, of course. There isn't a large lounge (waiting) area, only a couple of small sofas, so we settled in there. When our room was ready they said they had upgraded us to a suite (and it was beautiful). Our small balcony/window opened to look right across the street from the US Embassy. The "closet" was different - sort of looked like a huge suitcase sitting upright. We didn't use it since we were staying there only one night. We were told about the key card being needed to use the lights once inside; this was different but throughout the rest of our trip we found this to be the norm. We had a great breakfast buffet that was included with our room. It is in a great location and we would most definitely stay there again. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: PSantella
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a recent addition to Marriott's Autograph Collection, "a distinctive collection of hotels offering rich character and uncommon details" but obviously NOT customer service. First off the front desk staff did not recognize our Marriott Rewards membership and insisted that they were NOT a Marriott. After I showed them a copy of our online reservation made through the Marriott website and asked where the concierge lounge was (a supposed perk of our Gold status with Marriott Rewards and where we had anticipating waiting until our room was ready) they backpedaled and said they did not have a concierge lounge and offered us free breakfast instead, which we could not use as we were leaving very early the next morning for the airport. BTW - Their website clearly shows that they do have a concierge level in their hotel. The front desk manager attempted an apology and said that they would be happy to assist us in any way during our stay. When we were finally shown to our room, our luggage was not delivered. After waiting 20 minutes, we called down and requested that our luggage be sent up. After another 20 minutes, my husband and I went down to the lobby and retrieved our luggage and took it to our room. Later, I asked the front desk (same person who insisted that they were there to do anything for us) to place a local call to confirm my airport transfer for the next morning and I was told to call myself from my room. Upon check out the next morning, my husband requested change for a large Euro so that we could tip the bellman and our driver, and the same front desk person told us he didn't have change! If you are expecting ANY of the normal Marriott service or for that matter ANY common courtesy, do NOT plan a stay at this property..........a category 8 hotel in the $400-$500 range..........NOT worth the money in any respect.

Reviews.Title: “Minimoon Treat”
Reviews.Author: SnowWhitey
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a minimoon to Rome 2 days after we married and had chosen the Boscolo Palace Roma as he found a good deal on Expedia and the location suited us. We took our 8 month old daughter with us too (so not the most romantic minimoon lol). On arrival the staff were friendly and polite but our room was not ready so we were told there was a 15 minute wait. Not what you want to hear after a long journey with a baby! We decided to have lunch in the restaurant whilst we waited and were glad we did so as the staff were brilliant and the food was delicious- pricey as you'd expect from such a hotel in Rome. We had a junior suite and the room was spacious, clean and modern. Staff set up a travel cot in our room which had lovely little bath toys and toiletries for our daughter. We thought it was a nice touch. I was concerned by the marble tiles throughout with our little one and we did encounter a few bumps to the head! We also only had a shower in the room which wasn't the most convenient when travelling with a baby. Our stay overall was great, we didn't do much more than sleep in the hotel as we wanted to explore as much of Rome in 5 days as we possibly could. We had forgotten to book an airport transfer after our stay but staff did so for us with just an hours notice which we really appreciated. Whilst waiting to return to the airport I was given the key to our room to change my daughter as there were no other baby change facilities in the hotel. I did notice that the room had been made up for the next guests with complimentary dressing gowns which we were not given- I assume because we had the room at a discounted rate through Expedia, but that didn't seem fair. I also wouldn't recommend this hotel to families but my husband and I would stay again if visiting Rome alone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: raveland
Reviews.Content: I am confused that this hotel have got a lot of negative reviews. This usually leads to near-the-same experience because I am exacting visitor and notice details. However, this time I was lucky to get most of this hotel. The room was comfortable, staff was really helpful and nice. Location is not far from Spanish Steps so we started our walks from there. Not many hotels earn "Excellent" from me.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: scott r
Reviews.Content: Other reviews on Trip Advisor do not seem accurate for this wonderful hotel. The rooms are very well appointed, with an awesome bed! Cappuccino in the morning followed by amazing cycling and vatican tour on our 3 day stay. Your are 2 minutes from the metro & have quick access to the entire city. i would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself”
Reviews.Author: Melissa D
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful week in Rome using Marriott points and treated ourselves to two nights at the Boscolo Palace before moving to another Marriott for the remainder of the week. We wanted to be able to explore the city on foot from a great location - and what a location! On the famed Via Vittorio Veneto, across the street from the American Embassy, two doors from the Hard Rock Rome, 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, and one block from a metro stop. You can get anywhere you want easily. When you return to this intimate hotel, the staff recognizes you and welcomes you. They were very attentive and provided wonderful service. The rooms were luxurious in a modern Italian sense. The restaurant was definitely worth a visit. One of the best hotels we have enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Simply PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: businessmanankara
Reviews.Content: Well, we moved to this REAL 5 stars hotel in via vittorio veneto, after one nightmare at TERMİNİ.. It's no doubt a five stars...perfect location, perfect service, perfect rooms.. a bit expensive yes but it worths.. If you have a limitde budget, just try some little hotels in the same street, but DO NOT STAY around Termini..

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: Starks551
Reviews.Content: The best hotel My wife and I have ever stayed in. The staff is warm and friendly, and go out of their way for you. The rooms are spotless and awsome. We are coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbanderson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern, elegant and the staff that I dealth with provided incredible customer service. The breakfast buffet or a la carte - great choices - every morning I arrived - I was greeted by a lovely hostess who know my name and what I liked. Service was impeccalble. The rooms are very modern - fresh - new and bathrooms elegant. The only thing I would say that was not available at the time of my stay was a fitness centre. I was there for 8 nights - and fitness is important to my lifestyle. However, I did use the facility at another Boscolo hotel which was okay. Special thank you to Ilaria Del Gaudio, front manager. Amazing service, exceptional!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, but some issues”
Reviews.Author: socaltraveller18
Reviews.Content: Terrific location on Venato, and the staff was much friendlier than what has been written previously by other reviewers. That said, the rooms were small, shower does spill out easily, and the all marble floor for the entire room and bathroom are actually an issue for comfort. We were hoping for a hotel that had more of an old world charm, but that's more an issue of the travel agent that booked us. No huge complaints, just not a lot of charm to the hotel. I felt that the rates were too high for what's received

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: AJSTALLY
Reviews.Content: I only booked one night because I was concerned with bad reviews regarding rudeness,but the night front desk man that his first name started with M was great .He did everything to try to find my lost luggage at airport.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Leco1978
Reviews.Content: After reading some old reviews I was quite worried about this hotel. However, they turned out to be misguiding. I booked the cheaper rate/room and they gave me a very nice room at the highest floor with a balcony and a nice view of Rome. The only bad thing was that we had to anticipate our departure and they could not provide any kind of refund. Other than that, the hotel is nicely located and I felt very safe to walk at night around the hotel as it is in front of the US Embassy. I wish we could have stayed a little bit longer in this nice hotel and beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Won't go to a Boscolo hotel again...EVER”
Reviews.Author: Europhile006
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel months in advance and have NEVER been so disillusioned by a big expensive hotel. When we arrived after a long flight, we went to our room, and the light switch didn't work. Then I put our passports and money in the safe, A few hours later, we were going to go out to lunch. I couldn't open the safe to get my money. When the hotel sent someone up to check the lights and safe, he told me that the safe was broken. Someone from housekeeping had to come up and open the safe with a master key. In addition to that, when he opened the switchplate to see what was wrong with the light switch, he found NO WIRES behind the switch plate on the wall to turn the lights on or off. We wound up with a room that only had a shower and no tub, which was the reason I took the more expensive room when I booked the hotel. If that isn't enough, the second night we were there, we got up around 8:30 and went out to a museum. When we returned at 14:30, our room had STILL NOT BEEN MADE UP!! Again, I went down to the desk to complain, and finally at 16:30, the room was finally made up. When we left the hotel the third day, I asked the woman at the desk to please mail 3 post cards, Every card I mailed in Italy was deliveder with the exception of the three I gave to the woman at the desk at Boscolo. When I wrote to the hotel complaining after we returned to the states, the cards were finally mailed...three weeks AFTER we left. The hotel never even answered my e-mail in which I complained about our experience there. When we were at the hotel, I noticed a placcard behind the desk advertising cab service to the airport for 75 Euros. Outside the hotel is a taxi stand, and the fare to the airport is a fixed price...40 Euros!! In addition to that, I looked on line at another hotel we passed on Via Veneto, and it was 40% cheaper than Boscolo, and included breakfast which the Boscolo hotel didnt. We will NEVER go back to a Boscolo hotel again...EVER!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel walking distance from sights”
Reviews.Author: IlkkaL
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel did read some older reviews and was a bit worried. It was clear immediately upon arrival that this hotel has changed due to renovations and is clearly an excellent one. Staff is very attentive and friendly. Rooms are beautiful and very comfortable. Location is great and you get everywhere easily by walking or using metro which has station only few hundred meters away. Tjey had umbrellas for use in a rainy day and staff helped you in all wishes. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a disgrace - Best avoided!”
Reviews.Author: VeryFussyLady
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel truly unwelcome in a 5* hotel then this is the place to choose! I'll admit, the hotel IS in a great location and it HAS been recently refurbished. It's just so unfortunate that the staff are so ungracious - bordering on the unpleasant to the guests. When they're not ignoring you, they are distinctly looking down their noses at you! And please please look carefully at the photos of the rooms. What you can't quite spot is the scary pink and grey striped wallpaper - very 70s and probably very kitsch/trendy, but quite enough to give anyone a swift headache. All those lovely 5 star touches are missing here - no mini bars, no slippers, no free WiFi, no free water/fruit in the room. Such a shame, but there are much better 5 star hotels than this.. so choose wisely ;+)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel- very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: bonequeen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. A delightful boutique hotel with much to offer, recently renovated. Swiming pool and SPA not available, although advertised on some websites as operational. Planned later in the spring. Staff very attentive, excellent customer care. Good choice of breakfast . Disappointingly cost of drinks very expensive ( 22 Euros for a glass of wine and a liquer)-A 330 ml bottle of water from the hotel room cost 7 euros, however I am sure all of the hotels in this area charge this. There is a local daily tax which guests are required to additionally pay . We were charged 3 euros each however the ABTA company we booked with advised us the charge was 2 euros each per day. Advise to check such details upon arrival There is a supermarket near to the 'villa borghese park' underpass, at the top of the avenue- 29 cents for a 500 ml bottle of water. There is a taxi stand diagonally opposite hotel, the government has fixed taxi prices to Fumicino airport at 40 euros, not 70 euros as advertised at hotel reception. There is a bus which will take passengers single or return journey from airport to Termini train station in Rome for 8 euros each person each way ( 16 return ) ( 1 hour journey time each way), alternatively train costs 14-16 euros per person each way ( half hour journey time) Recommend to buy an underground 3 day pass (11 euros per person) or a Roma pass ( 22 euro per person). Find restaurants away from the tourists areas to avoid paying £120+ for an evening meal for two. Worth visiting the main tourist attractions . Vatican costs free to visit the church a wonderful experience. Sistine chapel and other museums in the vatican cost 15 euros so much to see. Plan to arrive early in the day to avid waiting for hours in queques. Plenty of designer shops. All in all a great 3 day short break. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: annabeltino
Reviews.Content: This is the most romantic clean well decorated hotel ive been in rome i really reccomended i will choose the boscolo forever such a lucky beautiful hotel for me trust me!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, but weird”
Reviews.Author: SheilaScotlandUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 day weekend in January. Found on arrival it was 'almost finished' with renovation, no spa, but this wasn't a problem as we hadn't expected a spa. Only heard some work being done on stairs for about ah hour. What was weird is that we felt we were the only customers, a bit like celebrities booking a whole high class hotel to ourselves. Room was beautiful, bed, bedding, bathroom were 5*. Location was wonderful too (don't bother with Cafe de Paris up the road though). Think any recent negative reviews are due to renovations. We got this at a great price, great breakfast included (full buffet set out for just us, can't complain).

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable time of our life!!”
Reviews.Author: zxcvbgdc556644f
Reviews.Content: Best memorable trip at a beautiful hotel. This hotel underwent a complete transformation from the design to the staff and the service. They had just opened 20 days prior to our visit. We walked around to many different hotels and we were fortunate to have chosen this one. We were at another hotel that was double price and this hotel and staff were much better. Very trendy rooms and very clean and big. It is located on Via Veneto so close to all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “We were made so welcome at the hotel we felt like long lost family”
Reviews.Author: peterwoods89
Reviews.Content: I understand that the hotel has only been open for one month since being refurbished. All the staff were so courteous and helpful in every way that we felt like celebrities. I think that we were the first guests to use room 601 since it was reopened. This was obviously the best room in the range we had chosen. The spa and facilities were not available at the time and one floor has yet to be refurbished but this is reflected in the price. If you want to stay in Rome in a 5 star hotel with 5 star service but 4 star price try the GRAND PALACE before the spa opens

Reviews.Title: “Never have promotional pictures been so deceiving !”
Reviews.Author: zuzu55
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensivley in Italy this was the worst hotel I ever had the misfortune to experience. Having been fooled by the pictures on the hotel`s website which, depicts beautiful elegant suites with spacious marble bathrooms, I desided to book a suite for myself and my familly . However , upon arrival I was very dissapointed . The carpet in the hallway was so dusty that when any pressure was applied to it plumes of dusty would rise up . The hotel had dank and dingy quality to it as well as having mold patches growing on the walls. Within the suite the carpet was worn , the tiles in the miniscule bathroom were black with grime and the bath still contained hairs from the rooms previous occupant . Futhermore,the bed linen smelt atrocious and had cigarette burns on them . Needless to say , my family and I stayed one night before leaving for anothe hotel . I would advise anyone to be very carefull when booking this hotel as it does not meet the quality someone would expect from a four star hotel ( although to its credit the staff were very nice ).

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcoming and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Mcloughlins
Reviews.Content: My husband and i spent Christmas (four nights) in Rome - arriving on Christmas Eve. We booked this hotel in advance and it was our first encounter with the city. It was very easily accessed from the Metro and positioned opposite the American Embassy on Via Vitorria Veneto. I have read some reviews on this website and I am disappointed to learn that others did not have as pleasant a stay as we did. On arrival the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and we were upgraded to a deluxe room and though slightly old fashioned, was really comfortable - 4 great nights of sleep were had. Breakfast was included which was also very tasty - lovely fresh fruit, pastries and coffees and plenty more besides. The breakfast room staff were particularly friendly and always smiling - even when working on Christmas morning!! It was a pleasure to come back to this hotel in the evenings after a tiring days sightseeing. Perhaps if people just relax and take their time to be friendly towards staff instead of running around like headless chickens with guide books, maps and cameras and really take in what Rome has to offer not just as an amazing city but everything then maybe their stay would not leave a bitter aftertaste!! I would most certainly recommend this hotel and had such a wonderful stay that I would definately return to Boscolo Grand Palace, Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Once upon a time this would have been a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: I_Love_Itally
Reviews.Content: The hotel presents well from the street, main foyer and bar area, however, the corridors and rooms are very 'tired'. The staff are generally friendly .... providing you do not ask questions. One concierge member became quite rude because I could not understand what they were saying. This could become a great hotel again if it had a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “i can't believe it's gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: nikifitz
Reviews.Content: i stayed here in 2007 for 3 nights with my boyfriend, when we got there the hotel from the outside looked posh and the location was fantastic, the street it is on is the best street in Rome, very upmarket, it was a little bit out t he waybut we enjoyed the walk down the tree lined street and there was a tour bus stop just at the bottom of the road. it was lovely, and harry's bar is just up the road- very expensive but definately worth a visit!! when we entered the hotel the staff on reception were rude but we didnt let it ruin anything, one man was nice, he was showing us where to go etc and gave us a map. We had a little walk round and it really was lovely, we got to the room and wasn't as nice as expected but we did have standard room and we got it at a good price, we weren't in the room long anyway. it was clean but looked like it had been forgotten about. We went down to the pool one night, i thought the pool was really nice, it was lit up when we went in and there was only us there, it was was lovely. i know it has been a while since i stayed there but i just cant believe its become that bad. i hope it gets better

Reviews.Title: “Geat location, but no Internet in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mary-EllenCallahan
Reviews.Content: Boscolo Grand Palace has many things going for it - most obviously its location in the historic center and within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps, However, it would be elevated with a facelift to the hallways and rooms, as well as making Internet available in the guest rooms. This was its biggest downfall for me - I travel for business and need Internet. At Boscolo Grand Palace it is only available in the lobby. Even at that, 1 of the 2 times I tried accessing it was it working. Aside from this, the typical Italian standard for hospitality and service are found here. I cannot comment on the food as I did not eat here, but the cappuccino was the finest I have ever had. The room decor is dated, but adequate. There is much needed A/C in Rome. My room on the fifth floor even had a balcony. I might even stay there again, when they get Internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Boscolo Hotel = Con Artists”
Reviews.Author: KC24_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night – happened to coincide with the European Championship final, so the staff were perhaps ruder and unfriendlier than their norm. Generally the staff seemed extremely inconvenienced to have guests staying at the hotel. We ended up in a room with an air conditioner that sounded like a tractor – after asking if we could change to another room we were told that as the hotel was fully booked we could either have a room with no a/c (given it was 30+ degrees, wasn’t an option) or the room we were already in. A rock and a hard place then. But by far the most galling part of staying at the Boscolo and the reason they get the title of con artist is because I had paid for the pleasure of staying at this dreadful place in advance through lastminute.com – and when I returned home I checked my credit card statement, only to see the Boscolo had charged a further EUR188 - I have since emailed and called them on multiple occasions and while they have said they are “looking into it” they have not deigned to give me a response or an explanation. I have asked to see a statement to account for any other expenses I may have incurred – but as there are none, they have nothing to show me. What a dirty, petty little hotel, ripping off unsuspecting guests of a paltry EUR188. Paying the initial amount was already a case of throwing good money down the drain – to be robbed of a further EUR 188 makes me very angry and I will be taking further action against the hotel. Not for the money but the principle, who do these people think they are? In my opinion this is theft. NB - not worth the one star , i would give it 0.25

Reviews.Title: “not very happy : -(”
Reviews.Author: KIMDN4
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed for four nights in march, they breakfast was cold the coffee tasted of dirt I asked if i could have proper italian coffee they said they thought i would not like it how wrong. The room they gave us was so small you could not swing a cat , I had instucted the hotel that this was a special anniversary and we would like a nice room , anyway because the hotel was very quiet they found us a much nicer room which was great apart from the rusty bath (not good) when we arrives back each night from going out to diiner there was no where in the hotel for drink no coffee facilites or no bar open I thought this was supposed to be a hotel how wrong. Be carefull when going in local restraunts they can realy rip you of 90 euros for half an hour in restraunt two meals 1 drink each . We learnt very quick to watch these italians.

Reviews.Title: “Boscolo Grand Palace, Rome.”
Reviews.Author: KathleenWales
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel before we read the reviews and if we hadn't, probably would have thought twice. However, we are so glad we stayed at the hotel; it was a lovely, olde world type of hotel with everything we wanted. When we arrived for a 4 night stay the receptionist said that we had been upgraded to a suite ( at no extra cost) .We were given a lovely large room, with wood block floors, a huge chandelier, and with the biggest bed I had ever seen! The bathroom was marble, chrome and gold - absolutely lovely - and everything spotless. Even the loo rolls smelled of rose petals! The staff were extremely helpful and kind and I would recommend the hotel to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: PaulBerkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: when we arrived at our Hotel, we were not greeted with even a hello or a smile, I had to approach the front desk, (bearing in mind that this is a “4 Star” Hotel), to announce our arrival and booking reference, not a great start! After booking in with the extremely unhelpful girl on the desk, we asked where the spa was, as this was the reason for choosing this particular hotel from my wife’s birthday present. We were told that the spa was shut and had been for 2 months, this is absolutely appalling and very upsetting for my wife especially. This information has not been forwarded to us and your website still advertises the facility. We then went to our room, which was a very poor standard and not as described in your information, in fact far from it! The room was extremely stuffy and hot, we opened the window only to be met with a noise like a race track and an excessive noise of car horns being sounded. We immediately shut the window and turned to the air conditioning which was also advertised in your info, (see enclosed). We went out for the evening to return to a room that was more like an oven, I felt the air conditioning louvers and to my surprise, were pumping out hot air despite selecting the snow symbol. We shut down the air conditioning and phoned reception, only to be told that there is no air conditioning as it is “winter time” despite the outside air temperature being 18 degrees! We opened the windows again, only to be met with traffic noise like I have never heard at that time of night, with the constant tooting of hooters, overreving of engines and if that wasn’t enough, mosquitoes! Needless to say that we could not sleep a wink. The following morning we went to receptions to complain only to be told that there was nothing they could do as the a/c was all turned off! With the weather cooling the following day we thought that we could at least cool the room down while we went to dinner by leaving the windows open! However, we returned to the room and it was just as hot as it had been, we suffered another horrendous and sleepless night. The next morning we insisted that something be done, the girl on the desk, with no apology, said she would send maintenance, we arrived back to our room that evening to find it hotter than ever, I found that they had just turned the heating on again!!! An absolute nightmare, my wife was in tears and we and were both absolutely shattered and I had been bitten half a dozen times by the mosquitoes!! This is all bad enough, taking that we were expecting a beautiful spa hotel and beautifully appointed rooms with marble tops (see hotel details), none of which existed, needless to say, nor did the bath robes or slippers they boast of, but more upsettingly there was no bar or restaurant, despite the hotels photos and descriptions’, It was a desolate conference room at best! Unsurprisingly, there was no information that this didn’t exist nor did the hotel announce the fact that all these facilities were not on offer despite Expedia’s and their website claims. I suggest that you update your website with immediate effect and send an inspector to assess your description against the reality of the situation.

Reviews.Title: “great location but not worthy the price”
Reviews.Author: lorenzo_lugano
Reviews.Content: i've just been there. great location and good room (but without internet connection...). but the experience wasn't very good. just arrived, the light did not turn on in the room (the solution was to insert a folded business card into an electronic device). then i attended a book presentation in a room (floor -2) where air conditioning wasn't working. very unconfortable experience. moreover, three people tried - succesfully, in the end - to activate internet connection for one of the speakers. it took about 45 minutes. then, when i went to the room back to sleep, i realized that air conditioning wasn't working there as well... so, not worthy of its price.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Grotty”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTravellerNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boscolo Palace in Rome last week on a family vacation. Checked in for two nights and left after one because the rooms were tired, musty, not very clean and the bathrooms were very grotty. The hotel looks truly 5 star on their website and this is completely misleading. We stayed at the Westin Excelsior the second night, more expensive but a much much better experience. I would not recommend the Boscolo Palace to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: charkleroad
Reviews.Content: Overrated, expensive, rooms smelled, beds were terrible. Breakfast buffet was awful. I only stayed one night because i arrived late in the day. Further, they promised a refund, in writing, but despite multiple follow ups, have not honored their commitment.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Bluejeans24
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - just down the hill and round the corner to the Hop on, Hop off bus (which took you around all the tourist attractions for 18 euros per day), and next door to the Hard Rock cafe. Buffet breakfast a bit limited and repetative. No curtain on shower therefore we soaked the bathroom floor all the time. No tea & coffee in room. Hotel was clean and the decor was very interesting. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Showers”
Reviews.Author: cheetah87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the "Grand Palace" for one night in October with a group of my colleagues. We had been very impressed with the Hotel's website and we weren't disappointed when we arrived as the reception and surrounding rooms seemed very oppulant and pleasant. The problems started in the rooms. I had to complain as my bedlinen was soiled and quite obviously had not been changed from the night before. The staff were reluctant to change the linen and made me feel as though I was being unreasonable. In addition the showers were appalling, the water was never a constant temperature and quickly changed from tepid, to scalding hot to freezing cold. If you do plan to stay here it may be a good idea if you request a room with a bath to avoid this problem. The food in the morning was not of a high standard and we ended up going elsewhere for breakfast. I beleive that any visitors to Rome would find better value elsewhere as this hotel was unnecessarily expensive and not as ideally located for sightseeing as its website may suggest.

Reviews.Title: “There are better Hotels out there”
Reviews.Author: Quality-men
Reviews.Content: I was taken here for my Birthday, the problem is that in Rome the Hotel rooms are smaller & more expensive than other capital cities. Now...................we understand that BUT there is an arrogance in this Hotel especially from the reception team that they are doing you a favour letting you stay here. The Hotel is beautiful, historic & in a great location, but you must remember that in these old Hotels a great number of rooms are in the attics, facing brick walls & back yards etc. So here it really is a question of you get what you pay for. The service is average at great service prices and the Restaurant whilst we were there was empty..........mmmm. I wonder why- because there are a huge number of quality restaurants in Rome without wasting money on this one. If you are going, then upgrade, upgrade, upgrade, you will get a view, a big room & a very very big bill!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid! avoid! avoid!”
Reviews.Author: mcconthebus
Reviews.Content: The staff are, in my opinion, hateful! I have never been treated with such non-caring before. And for the price! This place is terrible. When I asked the concierge for a good restaurant, he reached under the desk to grab one of a stack of post cards (which should have been a clue) to a restaurant that was pathetic. The rooms are shabby and dirty. Avoid this place!

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star superior”
Reviews.Author: Scottishtraveller002
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Grand Palace last night. We spent 10 days in this hotel. Our travel agent had built it up very high, as you wld expect for the price, and when we expressed our concerns over other trip advisor comments, she claimed they were untrue to that extent. HOWEVER, i must say right now, that this hotel is in NO WAY a four star superior by our standard. On initial impression the reception areas are fine, but on lugging our cases into the tiny elevators and arriving to our floor(6th) i was a little less impressed as the walls were for sure very shabby and in desperate need of a re-paint, room doors were like a yellow tar stain, door frames not on, door handles loose and ill fitting. On entrance to the room it was actually fine, except it was sooo hot, suffocatingly so we tried to put on the air conditioning to no avail. The reception said they not have air con working in the whole hotel, only the heating works at the moment and that our solution was to open the windows. Which we did, but it did not help much and we were faing the very busy Via Veneto road so it was very noisy all night. I phoned the reception, explaining i was pregnant and could not cope with this heat and asked for a fan which they did provide. The outside temp was lovely and to this day i have no idea why the room was so hot, all i can say is it must be their heating from below as we had our switched off. We were offered two other rooms but we refused as they were horrific, no natural light, floor to wall wood panelling, dark teak may i add(7th floor)! So we stayed with our original hot but somewhat modern room. Despite a restless sleep due to noise (open windows)and heat, the beds were quite comfortable. On waking we showered and went to breakfast. OH DEAR, for those who dont have it included unlike us DONT GO TO BREAKFAST!!!! it was the worst i have seen, and if u do choose to try the eggs and bacon, get early or they will be cold! I stuck to cereal, bread and a coffee. We did eat most times however for breaky. Via Veneto is a great location, i think one of the most pleasant we walked around, plenty of restaurants and close to a good few sights! This area is full of grand hotels. For dinner i would recommend gran caffe Roma which is the first as u walk down under a canopy, waiters are very friendly(unlike a lot of roman waiters) and the food lovely...the pasta with mushrooms was good and the steak excellent! A little further down was a good one which sells lots of seafood, i had the grilled salmon which was very nice also. There are numerous restaurants some are great, others not so. Back at the hotel the swimming pool although attractive looking, is so small you can barely swin alongside anyone else. The spa is in no way like a spa here. My partner and i both booked a massage for the same time, his older lady was fine, but my younger lass gently stroked my back for 55 euros for 30 mins, despite me asking her to be a little firmer. I would not stay at this hotel again purely due to the fact it was not as high a standard as it charges, and lack of things to do(i.e pool too small and tv only has CNN repeated) it cost 18 euro for to watch the english movie! By day of course you are out sightseeing and for dinner also, but some nights we just wanted to relax and found it hard within this hotel. As for the staff, breakfast staff not friendly at all, bar staff never around and always on their mobile phones when they are rarely seen, reception staff i have no complaints over. Although not as helpful or attentive as our own hotels here in Scotland, they were for what we seen of some Roman manners good.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: fussyholidays_7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Palace Hotel Rome. It is in a good safe area and a few minutes walk down to the tube and the bus stops. Go into the newsagents to buy a weekly ticket and then you can get on and off the tube and the buses with no stress. The room that we had was on the front of the hotel looking onto the Via Venetta. It was large and very comfortable. Linen and towels were changed daily. The room was a little shabby but very clean . The breakfast was adequate but have had better. Bacon and eggs were cold but there was fruit and yoghurt and small rolls. Coffee came by the cup. BEWARE. Dont sit down in a coffee shop unless you can see the prices. It is at least 4 times the amount to sit at a table and they will rip you off because you look like a tourist. Don't put anything in your pockets as your phone will be lifted.We saw empty purses thrown down.It is a very expensive city so be prepared. I booked an airport transfer from Ciampino with [--]and they were excellent. 44 euros each way and no problems. We heard stories of 100 euros from the airport by just getting into a taxi. Don't commit to anything without a price. All of the squares and main fountains are spoiled by sellers hassling you to buy cheap trash. They really will not leave you alone The Trevi was the worst. A lovely city but dirty under foot. Graffitti every where. Litter and cigarette ends every where. I just felt that you had to be on your guard all of the time, but then that's a city trading on the past and full of tourists that they really don't care about.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: blackdogx3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boscolo on Via Veneto in for 4 nights in December. The location was good. It was close to the Metro station, which made getting around the city very easy (and inexpensive). It is also close to the Spanish Steps. There are a lot of nice restaurants, and it is a good location for shopping. The hotel itself was a bit of a disappointment. When I first arrived, I had to wait a long time (several hours) before my room was available, even though I had made reservations months in advance, and the staff was less than helpful. The room was VERY SMALL, which is the usual for Europe. It was clean, but for the price paid, it was not well maintained. I was expecting a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic???”
Reviews.Author: hibiscus-Sue
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good but perhaps they are marketing it with the decorating style called "Shabby Chic"?? I did not find peeling veneer and paint, areas of grey from use on the white doors etc. attractive at all. Our first room was so small we had to walk sideways to get into the bed. There was no desk space, no chair to sit in, nor any place to put our suitcases! There were just two little flat pillows on the bed (and having no chair to sit in one had to use the bed for sitting, reading etc.) and there were only 4 hangers in the closet. (We had more pillows and hangers delivered to the room) After complaining about the room size we were moved two days later to a MUCH larger room down the hall (3 times the size) but the condition was rather similar. (We transferred all the pillows and hangers to this room since the pillow and hanger situation was the same) There was a chair but just a small straight chair, not even worthy of sitting in. Much to my husband's dismay there is NO internet access in this hotel (and he had business to conduct which required use of his laptop). We Americans take for granted that all hotels have internet access....not so! Italy seems to be lagging technologically since we found that this is the case with many hotels there so one must check in advance.

Reviews.Title: “So bad I had to move out”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the Via Veneto on business in October 2007. I was due to stay two nights but checked out after the first night because the experience was so bad. The room had been poorly maintained - for example the shower was hanging by one screw from the wall. The breakfast was very basic. The staff were unfriendly and uncooperative. There was no internet access (essential for business travellers these days) and the whole hotel was over-heated. I moved to the hotel next door (Baglioni Regina) which had the same number of stars and looked similar from the outside, but was a completely different experience. The rumour was that the Boscolo Palace was being run down prior to refurbishment. I can believe it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was deceptive”
Reviews.Author: PeekytoeLouisiana
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on its affiliation with Boscolo, usually a good hotel line. It was disappointing. Reception staff very poor with directions and seemed irritated when we didn't understand. Big sign for "Breakfast, 15 Euro." When we checked out we found we'd been charged 30 Euro each. When I questioned it we were told we ate "the American breakfast, which was twice as much." No one ever told us there were two breakfasts or two prices - the sign was (we believed) deliberately deceptive. When we complained, they just said "Sorry, madame."

Reviews.Title: “I agree with "rockguy"!”
Reviews.Author: gr8tful
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, one of THE WORST hotels I've ever stayed in in Europe - or anywhere for that matter! The room carpeting was so soiled it was black! The staff was rude and unresponsive to any requests. The breakfast worse than what you'd get in a school cafeteria. And the cost for all of this disappointment was outrageous!! Trust me........if your travel agent suggests this venue - immediately fire him or her!

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a hotel by its cover!!!!!! Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Rockguy
Reviews.Content: We were on a tour of Italy with a group of about 40 other people and had stayed in hotels from Milan to Rome. We stayed at the Grand Hotel Palace from 10/11/07 to 10/13/07 and had a horrible experience. The front desk people were rude to us and members of our group, one of our group asked for a new box of Kleenex and was told to use toilet paper (by the Front Desk Manager!). When you walk in the front lobby is beautiful and that is where it ends. Our room was in desperate need of attention, the bed was worn out and generally dirty. The bathroom was very dirty and in need of refreshing. Things like the tub was moldy and the tile was in bad condition. The shower...oh boy, look out you may get scalded as the water goes hot cold, hot cold, hot cold all the time the water is on. The bar was not staffed and would not have been worth having a drink there any way as the selection was very poor. The breakfast was okay but the staff was very un-friendly; my wife and I had an early departure so we wanted to get in right away to eat. We walked through the doors four minutes to 7:00AM and were told that "we aren't open until 7:00" and were not seated or asked if we needed anything to drink. As of this point I will never stay at the Boscolo chain of hotels again as they are not worthy of their price and are no better than a $25.00 hotel in America. Upon checkout they told me that I owed another 5 Euro for a bottle of water which neither my wife or I had. I told them that I would not pay for it and the woman behind the desk was very rude and disrespectful.The other members of our group had similar experiences and I'm sure will not be staying at any Boscolo's after this experience either. On a much less important note was the elevators are tiny and it is very hard to get luggage into and out of. The last thing is they only have one room key and you are asked to turn it in every time you leave the hotel, which I would not do since you have to ask to get it every time you return from your outings which is very tedious and un-necassary in my opinion. We stayed at a Boscolo hotel in Verona and it was better but still not worthy of the price we were paying for it so I would recommend not even looking at any of their hotels as you will probably get much, much less than you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Past it's best”
Reviews.Author: irishnomad
Reviews.Content: Like the rest of the Via Veneto I fear this hotel may be living off the reputation of the heady days of La Dolce Vita in the 1950s. It looks absolutely stunning from the outside however when you get to the room the cracks start to show. Dusty and bathrooms which would be in need of some renovation. We had a room which had a balcony placed directly over the air conditioning units. A bit noisy but we were pleased to have the balcony in the heat of the summer. The room was also quite dark as it was on a corner at the back of the building. For this reason though it was probably quieter than those facing the Via Veneto. Also, the staff were a little distant which I haven't come across before. Drinks in the bar would be a little expensive but such a beautiful room that you don't mind paying for just one but no more than that! Restaurants in area can be a little expensive too but lovely for a treat. We went to one on our last night which was just opposite the church where the tourist bus stops. It's attached to a hotel and sits above the street on a little terrace. Food and service were excellent. On the cheaper side there is a little family run pizza/pasta restaurant called Coyote a few streets back which is good value for the area. Down near the trevi fountain there's a little pizza restaurant called Mi Amore (?) which does a great pizza romana. I'd definately recommend the Galleria Borghese in the Villa Borghese. When we were there they had a great Renoir exibit. Overall, fantastic location and beautiful building which is just a little dated. If it were to be renovated I would imagine that this hotel would be spectacular once more.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: berkshire_nomads
Reviews.Content: Great location, and a building which was once probably beautiful, however it's now really showing its age. Nothing dramatic, but all the fabric looks a bit faded, paint is a bit marked, furniture chipped or broken. The bedclothes were thin and there was no spare blanket in the room. I could have asked for one, in fairness, but as I got back late I didn't want to risk a long wait. The heating is noisy and makes no noticeable difference so I spent a chilly night. In the morning no matter how much I tried to regulate the temperature the shower oscillated randomly between a freezing torrent and a scalding trickle. Breakfast was completely uninspiring; a very minimal choice. I also had to wait for ages checking in and out. This is all a real shame as I was in a 5th floor corner room with a huge wrap around balcony and fabulous views. If the maintenance and service lived up to the building's potetntial, it would be well worth the 300 Euros (!) I paid

Reviews.Title: “Inspired to stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: opticalamplifier
Reviews.Content: First, as an experienced traveler, I should have known not to make a reservation based on a 4-star rating. Also, I should have heeded to the reviews I read regarding this hotel. I thought it cannot be that bad being a 4-star. WRONG. There is nothing GRAND about the Grand Palace. The toliet did not work for three of the four days we stayed. No shower, and to make matters worse, the wand used to mimick the shower head was broken and water went everywhere when used. The room was dark, only one window and it was shaded on both sides. One electrical outlet in the room! The front desk staff is short on "service" and long on incompetence. The staff attempts to be a jack of all trades but reflects a master of NONE. I asked for the location of one street in Rome and the front desk did not even know it was right next to the hotel. I asked for additional pillows and was told the hotel was OUT of pillows. Watch out for the restaurant recommendations unless it is Il Veneto (outstanding). Internet in the rooms (as advertised), forget it. According to the front desk staff, the internet was broken. Fact of the matter, there is only one terminal in the lobby and it is on a first come first serve basis...and people don't mind just sitting there while you wait. Location of the hotel is very convenient, but nothing more. I will once again be in Rome in two weeks, and you can be assurred I will NOT be staying at the Grand Palace...then or ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Standards”
Reviews.Author: cantona46
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Boscolo Grand Palace from 9/15 to 9/19/07, and expected much higher standards from a 4 star hotel. On the positive side, the location is excellent, the exterior is pretty, and the front desk personnel were pleasant. However, although it advertises that most rooms have a view of the Via Veneto, and I specifically requested that view as well as a balcony, we received neither. The room was nice sized, but the fabric wall covering was worn and dirty. The bed linens were very nice, but the mattress was saggy...again a shock in a well rated hotel. The bathroom tiles were not in very good repair, and there was mold growing around the tub edges and corners. The sink had an integrated towel rack that was broken and unsightly. There was also dust on the wall lamp beside the bed and the rug looked like it had not been vacuumed. The first 2 nights we had 2 large bath towels as well as 2 smaller bath towels and hand towels. The next 2 nights, those large towels disappeared. There was no sign of any robes, although our friends in another room did receive 1 robe for 1 night! The lobby is archetecturally interesting, but the furnishings are gaudy rather than elegant. There is no concierge or door man. The desk staff attempted to answer questions, but did not always give the best information. On the day of our arrival we inquired about a nice but casual restaurant we could walk to. The desk clerk sent us on a 20 minute walk to a nice looking, but very high priced restaurant. We were neither dressed nor prepared for that kind of dining, and found an alternate eating spot on our own. Finally, they discouraged the use of our initial taxi from the airport in favor of one they would call for our return. The cost quoted was 70 Euros for the 2 of us! We located a shuttle service that advertised at a nearby tour bus stop, and were taxied back to the airport on our departure day for a total of 32 Euros. What should have been a service for guests (contacting a reliable taxi or shuttle service) was instead a money making operation that I presume involved a generous referral fee to the hotel. If this were rated as a 3 star hotel, it would have been "okay", but it does not deliver the expectations of a first class 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - your reservation isn't always valid!”
Reviews.Author: Orthelia
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed on my recent stay at the hotel that I feel compelled to share the experience with others. I took my mother to Rome for a special treat and selected the hotel, as I had seen it on another visit and thought the location and old world charm would be perfect. We arrived on the Friday night and were told that a diplomatic delegation was staying another night, so we had to stay else where - even though I had secured my reservation with the hotel directly using my credit card. This news was casually given to us and I was even told that the other hotel cost more, but they wouldn't be charging me! When I told the manager I wasn't happy with this arrangement, he even raised his voice with me! We were told that we would be going to a hotel the other side of town that wasn't even in the Boscolo group. When we got there are room wasn't up to the same standard and we couldn't relax as we had to go back to the Grand Palace on the next night. Given that I was assured that it would be made up to me, I expected perhaps some flowers in the room/a fruit basket (as one would expect in any decent hotel!) No such luck and I had to stand my ground to get any kind of discount. On a two day stay, having made a secured reservation you expect more than to be transferred to two hotels. By the casual attitude I would say that this happens regularly and it ruined the special treat for my mother. Think twice before you make a reservation at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grande Palace!”
Reviews.Author: awatt
Reviews.Content: We styaed 2 nights in Aigust 2007. This was out first trip to Rome and also to Europe. The hotel is beautifully done and the neighborhood can't be beat, very lovely place to stroll after dinner. Service in the hotel was excellent, exceeeded my expectations. As ther ewere no quad rooms we were given what I believe is a suite. We had a corner king room overlooking the Via Veneto with a small hallway connecting to another king room. Both rooms were clean and well kept. The corner room was huge. Beds very comfortable. The only negative I can think of is teh breakfast buffet in teh morning was skimpy, they ran out of things and didn't replenish quickly. We were delighted with our accomadations and the staff and will stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_54
Reviews.Content: The Grand Palace Hotel has a superb location on Via Veneto in one of Rome's smarter areas. Quite convenient for Metro and buses but you can walk to most of the main places of interest in 30 minutes. Much of Rome is quite dead in August and the hotel appeared to be less than half full. Buffet breakfast was not as extensive as we'd have expected and at €15 was about the price one would expect. More was available if you paid extra. Jimmiz restaurant was very good and the prices were very reasonable. Our room was excellent, clean and comfortable and service was generally good. The minibar was not as well stocked as it might have been, if you're going to provide these, you might as well fill them. Overall though, I'd be very happy to return, probably at a different time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - manager and staff are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: traveller200724
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boscolo for 4 nights at the end of July 2007. I had a fantastic time. The manager and staff were warm and friendly and extremely helpful. When I arrived I was allocated a room on the first floor - the room was not to my standard - when I complained the manager and staff were fantastic and upgraded me to a newly renovated room (which was amazing). I really enjoyed my time at the hotel. The location is perfect for shopping and near all main tourist spots. The hotel is old and is currently being upgraded. I would recommend this hotel and would suggest that you ask for Room 608.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: amwerewolfinlondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right across from the American Embassy. The lobby is quite small and service isn't really top notch. We booked based on it's 4 star rating. Clean rooms, good location - walking distance to everything. But if you're looking for luxury I'd recommend somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaRK73
Reviews.Content: North American tourists beware. Their 4 or 5 star hotels are not what we would expect. I think they refer their star ratings based on the location. If this is the case, then the Boscolo Palace deserves a 5-star rating. It is situated right in the heart of the city on Via Veneto. Amongst the countless attractions, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, and all the shopping (my wife loved this) you want are all within a 5-10 minute walking distance. This is a great starting point to see all the history of Rome. As far as the hotel itself, it was an expensive hotel to just bathe and sleep in (our "deal" was for $230 Euros a night, or about $340 Cdn ... gulp!). The room was small. The washroom was on the moldy side but if your vision's not 20/20, it's hardly noticeable. You will, however, notice the air conditioning. You can hear it working but don't expect to feel it. We stayed here for 5 nights and our room was never more than a degree or two cooler than the outdoor temperature ... and, yes, I had the thermostat at its coldest setting. Overall, I was content with this hotel (just pray for cool breezy nights like we had). It is a great starting point for any tourist who don't mind paying a little extra to get their sightseeing started right away. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: greekgodessLondon
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dated and the matresses old. The bathroom was terrible. The grouting was falling off the tiles, the bath tub itself had a hole in it which was very badly mended. I could do a better DIY job myself....and I'm no expert. The breakfast was the worst I have eaten in any hotel. The hotel's dining menu consisted of frozen dishes...not the kind of food I'd expect in Italy. Service, whether it was reception, housekeeping or waiter was varied. It really was down to who was on duty. Some were exceptional, others very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: pmkdo
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great and the location is perfect. Unfortunately the service is terrible. The concierge/ check in staff is not knowlegeable. Guliano is a fountain of misinformation. If he does not know an answer, he makes things up. It took 3 requests for another blanket and we never got a mat for the slipery bathtub. One could die of thirst at the bar, we resorted to pouring our own drinks. If ever a staff needed training in customer service, this was it.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: edmitran
Reviews.Content: The SUPERIOR King was indeed king but not at all superior!. No balcony as mentioned in some reviews. Rather an ordinary worn out room, particularly condidering the price! The weather in Rome was very hot during our stay (over 30C) and the air-condition made noise but did not cool! The staff at reception reacted with indifference to the complaint and an attempted repair ( the next day ) brought little relief!

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: UK_member92
Reviews.Content: Joined husband at close of his business trip to Rome for a 5 day holiday. Location near Via Veneto, 5 minutes downhill walk to Metro Barberini, easy walk to Spanish Steps. Large, quiet, comfortable room with small balcony overlooking US embassy (old palace). Attentive staff, good buffet breakfast (not included in rate). Large, comfortable public rooms, 1920s decor. No dinner in hotel. Very nice hotel and location for first visit to Rome. Slow but free internet access in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby...much better choices elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: saradeva
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel expecting a very nice 4 star, especially considering that it's well located on the Via Veneto amid all the other hotels of excellent standard. We were wrong. The reception staff is very stale...not very friendly and I always felt that I was bothering them if I ever needed anything. The rooms are very dated (and not in a quaint way) The facilities are minimal. For example, there wasn't even an iron in the room?..unheard of for a 4 star! We were upgraded to a larger room to facilitate our baby's cot, which was nice. We didn't even SEE the pool because the hotel is quite uninviting and we had no desire to spend time there. The location is great...just a short walk to the Metro stop and about 5 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps, BUT for the money there are much better hotels to choose from. We saw MANY on our walks around the area. Be warned that Rome is not set up for tourists at all...there are no info sights so be prepared with a plan of what you'd like to see and how to get there. We found that out the hard way. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: honest-Travellers
Reviews.Content: A truely excellent and memorable weekend. Perfect location for metro, restaurant,s shops and attractions. We stayed for 3nights at this beautiful hotel on the "Love and Romance" package. Our room was the honeymoon suite which had a large bed, double wardrobes, free safe, double balcony and large fashionable bathroom with his and her sinks. We were greeted with a complementary bottle of wine, chocolates and flowers in room on arrival. Everything was kept very clean and staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Breakfast was a little dissapointing but had the basics. At breakfast found it very hard to get waiter service. Hotel restaurant food excellent in main restaurant. Only thing id recommend is to keep a very close eye on your room bill as at one point they tried to charge us for room service when it was included on our package deal and charged us for the mini bar when we had not used anything from it. A can of pepsi is charged at 5.50euros from room mini bar which is about £3 so i recomend buy your drinks from local supermarket. Overall would definatly return to this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive disappointment”
Reviews.Author: aliandbaba
Reviews.Content: Such a fantastic location. The exterior of the hotel and the entrance foyer promised great things however we were shown three bedrooms before we found one which was acceptable,just! The furnishings were tired and shabby and the bathroom in great need of updating.
