The wall and floor tiles were cracked and missing and the curtain in the bathroom which was held up with sellotape, fell down. The minibar didn't work and requests for room service were answered very slowly if at all. The pool was tiny and poorly lit having more of a grotto effect. Anyone wishing an early morning swim before a days sightseeing would be disappointed as the pool did not open until 10.30am Breakfast was also very disappointing with a very small range of foodstuffs to choose from. Altogether a disappointing experience in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdl99
Reviews.Content: The Grand Palace is located on a beautiful, tree lined street. The lobby is nice and you can use the internet for free. The room is very small and slightly worn. The bathroom was clean but nothing spectacular. We loved the balcony with table and chairs. The breakfast was great. I would recommend it to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Bad quality/price rate : avoid it”
Reviews.Author: joselito
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in August. To be honest, this hotel is not bad. But, considering the price, it's easy to find other hotels with much better services, cleaner, newer. Looby, front desk, corridors are beautiful:marble, wood, ancient furnitures. Our room was really impressive at first: extra large, ancient bed and desk. But curtains, greyed, looked dirty, missing tyles (wooden floor) under the bed (??), bathroom gave a feeling not being clean (old joint between tyles, suspicious marks in the bath) no shower. Breakfast is a pity for such an hotel: few choice or no choice after 10am, some cereals and fruits. Not difficult to do better. Service was slow and some servers seemed not please to work for customers. Swimming pool: Ah, Ah the swimming pool. Ok, I agree not many hotel have one in Roma. But that one is more a large roman bath than a swimming pool. With only one swimmer, take care with the walls, they are close, with two swimmers, you will have a massage by your neighbour :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby but then you get to the room...”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl2690
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel is very impressive. When we arrived to our room there were towels on the bathroom floor around the toilet and very dingy and worn appointments. We went downstairs and they moved us to another room which wasn't much better. The bathtub was full of mold. The hotel needs some desparate remodeling and TLC. The staff was somewhat helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel not very Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: RGARCIAMD
Reviews.Content: No door man to help you with anything. Understaffed. Beautiful old building that needs a face lift. The rooms must have been nice fifty years ago. The mini bar is locked and they do not give you a key. They will open it if you call every day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but you're paying for it...”
Reviews.Author: BarntonDave
Reviews.Content: Impressive looking building and reception. We were there as a party of 8 adults on a weekend break. We were on the 6th floor with nice views out. Bedroom and bathrooms were both big and clean. In room (free) safe was a bonus. Staff were always available and helpful (when we needed them). Confusion over breakfast which we had to pay for and it wasn't worth it. There are cafes up towards the termini which are much better value. In hotel drinking was expensive (compared to the other cities we've visited) but with the hors doeuvres meant that it wasn't too bad value. Overall it was about what we expected. Though of all the cities we've visited, Rome was the only one where we felt ripped off (and yes, pick pocketed).

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great first impression as you walk through the lobby, and that's where the value of this hotel ends. Rooms and hallways need extensive repairs and updating. As others have noted, we had serious plumbing problems including nothing but scolding hot water in the shower. Mold in the bathtub is unacceptable. 10 Euros for a soda is outrageous even for a 'luxury' hotel. The breakfast staff was slow and did not seem to be interested in serving our family. A statement on their breakfast menu reads 'overlooking the needs of our guests'. NO KIDDING. When we expressed our concerns, the front desk told us to write a letter. That was it. At another time, two clerks were engaged in unprofessional conversation with several people in the lobby. We've told our guide to stop referring her clients to this hotel. There are other hotels within the area. Not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, safe location”
Reviews.Author: HydeP_traveler
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome April 6 - 9 and stayed at the Palace. As a single parent visiting with a 5 year old child, I cannot voice loudly enough how safe I felt in this neighborhood. We were walking distance to Spanish Steps, Via Condotti, Trevi Fountain and fabulous cafes. We even walked all the way to Piazza Novona (sp?) and the Colosseum one day (and easily took the subway back to the hotel). The service was outstanding! I feel bad for individuals who note on other reviews that they had a bad experience with the staff. They were superb. Practically all of them spoke English and the slightest request for help was met with "whatever we can do for madam". They helped clarify confusion with my tours and when we were rushed one morning to catch a tour, the breakfast staff packed up goodies for us to take with us. It appears they are doing upgrades with construction. We were originally placed in a 2nd floor room with much noise, but when I called to inquire about it - they moved me immediately to the 7th floor with a balcony. We were facing a side street, so had little to no street noise. Okay, time for the concerns: the 2nd floor room had air conditioning - the 7th floor room air didn't work - but I just opened the balcony doors (was told later by the staff that they turn it off in spring, hmmm?). The bathroom, was beautiful and large, however, there is a problem with black (mold?) stains AND the shower/tub leaked out the bottom! The beds were not the most comfortable (they were two twins pushed together). Definitely not the type of bed you would get in the US for 4 star hotel (pillow top, etc). The million dollar question, would I stay there again: YES!!!! The hospitality and location alone make this a superb choice.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous stay!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandSpringTravel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Italy. While in Rome, stayed at the Grand Hotel Palace March 26-30. Marvelous location, excellent service, we highly recommend it. Walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese, Trevi Fountain and a couple of blocks from the Barberini metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, moldy shower”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome. We stayed at Boscolo Grand for 3 days. As stated, the lobby and common areas are beautiful. However our room was a bit dingy. The carpet was old and the bed was a bit uncomfortable (needed a new mattress). The bathroom was very nice, large and clean, my only real complaint was the shower. It was moldy and the majority of the water came from the shower head on the sides (about waist height) and water leaked all over the floor. We were on the 5th floor. Our room had a large balcony with table and chairs (great for a smoker). It overlooked the street and faced the U.S. Embassy. The street noice could be heard all night, but wasn't too bad. I swear, Rome never sleeps. Our luggage was lost by the airlines. The connoisseur contacted the airport and delivered it to our room that evening. The majority of the staff did not speak English. The location is great. Our first day we hit Hard Rock Cafe (right around the corner) for a little comfort food before starting our vacation. There is a little market (underground), several cafes, small shops and bakery's within a block or two. The tourist bus as well a local bus stop is right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Boscolo Grand Palace Hotel is what could be described as a small grand hotel with under 100 rooms. It is wonderfully situated on the Via Veneto in easy walking distance of the Borghese Gardens, the Spanish Steps, and the Piazza Barbarini. The lobby and public rooms are very attractive and impeccably maintained. The 1920's murals in the lounge give the hotel a great period ambience. Our room (402) was spacious by European standards, very tastefully furnished, and relatively recently redecorated. The bathroom was done in green tile. Although there were some very minor plumbing issues, our overall room experience was very positive. We did not have extraordinary service needs, but we were impressed by the courteousness and promptness of the hotel staff in taking our bags, checking us in and out, and making arrangements for transportation to the airport. The total price was about $190 USD per night which I believe was a very fair price for a hotel of this quality. This is the sixth hotel that we have stayed at in Rome and for experience and value it compares very favorably.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, safe area”
Reviews.Author: ItaliaClive
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean and well maintained. Bathroom and Plumbing up to date and very clean. Well maintained property. Efficient,friendly staff-they treated Americans very kindly. Breakfast buffet good, but expensive. Beautiful area surrounding the hotel and location is central. Air conditioning system in the room was a bit noisy. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I ended up taking a classic double room at the Boscolo after we had to move out of our original hotel booked through Expedia as it was such a dissapointment. We can not recommend Boscolo Hotels highly enough - they truly saved our vacation. The staff were incredibly friendly and the rooms were large, spacious, of a high quality and very comfortable. Situated in an exccellent location, within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps and centre of Rome, the Boscolo is a fantastic 4 star hotel and definitely worth a visit. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super location but not quite a 4*”
Reviews.Author: lilly_lulsgate
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the hotel, all staff were excellent and polite. The bar drinks were very very over priced beware 30 euros for just two drinks. Also a bottle of water from the mini bar was 5 euros. The room was very spacious and comfortable but the bathroom needs a little updating. The hotel itself was very clean but shows signs of age. We did not eat in the hotel resturant as there are so many excellent resturants off the main high street cheaper. Also be aware of taxis as we were charged 20 euros from the main station to the hotel when we first arrived. We used the 110 open top bus for two days, you can get on and off at all the main attractions and stops just down the road from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: traveluk
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensively I am shocked that this hotel is rated a 4 star. The reception and breakfast staff were efficient and the concierge very informative. The location was very good for sightseeing and eating out. perhaps that is why it has an official 4 rating? However our room also had major problems in the bathroom. The bath did not have a plug but the water kept rising and did not drain until 3-4 hours later. We called reception who advised that it would be fixed the following day. When we left a day later the problem had not been rectified. Prices in the bar and restaurant were very expensive but again you would expect that. By walking down the narrow streets close to the Via Veneto you will find some lovely, inexpensive restaurants where the food was fantastic. If they worked on the rooms and the plumbing then this would surely rate a 4star

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: AK10London
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent with friendly service. We got a great price through Expedia. After the first night we told the staff that the shower wasn't draining properly and were promptly moved to another much larger hotel. The location is great, centrally located but not busy. I would definitely stay there again. Only drawback was that two bottles of water from the minibar cost €10! Huge buffet breakfast was €15 which was good value compared to all the cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingdave19
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice stay at the Boscolo on Via Veneto. Hotels in Rome are extremely pricey but we got a discount on Expedia for booking more than 3 nights. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to the spanish steps. The rooms were rather old but clean. The concierge was the most helpful I have experienced in a long time. I would stay at the Boscolo Grand Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Palace recently, we got a better deal by booking direct with the Hotel website 30+ days in advance. The location is terrific, many cafes (pricey) on the main drag Vai Veneto, but don't miss La Fontanelle Sistina just off the Triton Fountain square to the East Side after the pharmacy. The staff was very nice, the breakfast was good, just be ready for cold salad and salami! The rooms were large, if showing their age, and traffic noise was loud. Taxis were much easier to get than in Paris, and the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain were within walking distance. No hassles with pickpockets or gypsies, the Colosseum and St. Peter's were great, but the Vatican Museums were a crowded, smelly ordeal. By the time you get to the Sistine Chapel, your reaction may be like mine: "another gas chamber full of B.O. with a painted ceiling, where's the way out. Try renting a car outside of town for longer excursions, driving in Rome is not for the faint of heart.

Reviews.Title: “loud on bottom floors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a junior suite, paid for by business client. We were disappointed because both nights the music from the nightclub below kept us awake, even though we were in a junior suite and even after the staff PROMISED the noise would be taken care of. They said it had just opened and that it would be quiet, but it was not. a big disappointment and much worse than cheaper hotels we stayed in later in our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay and Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two periods in September. The staff was uniformally helpful and courteous. We received a free upgrade to superior rooms - and had a wonderful balcony and spacious room. Breakfast service was adequate. The location was marvelous and we would recommend it to anyoen wishing to visit the museums and churches of central Rome. Close to excellent shopping as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure it was worth the money”
Reviews.Author: BM29
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel generally but could do with touching up on a few things:- noisy air conditioning unit, shower didn't stay in place very well, bath area in need of renewal. After checking out on the last morning we had the day in Rome and there was no shower for us to use before we went home - I thought this was standard of all accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: SonCor
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fantastic wedding in Rome and stayed at the Boscolo Grande Palace. Service was superb, room was fantastic (with the largest bathroom I have seen ever), located very close to all amenities including outside restaurants, bars, shopping:) and sites, need walking shoes but what a beautiful city. Friends stayed in Adelph and I thought our room and bathroom was superior at a lessor price. Would reccommend this hotel to my best friend.

HotelInfo.Name: Boscolo Palace Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittorio Veneto 70, 00187 Rome, Italy
